physical_appearance: "This is a coloured print depicting various scenes that have been segmented by lines into individual frames. Two captions can be found beneath the central image and they are ""Meeting of Malay Sultans and Rajahs at Government House"" and ""The Duke and Duchess of Connaught at Singapore"". "
sgcool_label_text: This is a montage of scenes related to the visit of the Duke and Duchess of Connaught to Singapore in 1890. Connaught Drive, a new road at the Esplanade along the reclaimed sea front was named in honour of their visit, with the Duke and Duchess being the first users of the road upon their arrival in Singapore on 25 March 1890.
context_1: The Duke and Duchess of Connaught's visit to Singapore
title_text: "Print from The Graphic titled ""The Duke and Duchess of Connaught at Singapore"""
subject_terms_1: montages (visual works)  colonialism  colonies British Colonial  royalty (nobility)  reclamation  opening (events)
